abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Rural Development
            Project is to improve agricultural production and access to
            markets for Georgia's small and medium-scale farmers
            and rural enterprises supported by the project, through: (i)
            increasing the competitiveness of selected supply chains;
            (ii) strengthening the delivery of rural financial services
            and of the financial intermediaries; and (iii) modernizing
            key institutions for food safety and property registration
            with direct impact for increasing competitiveness of
            Georgia's agriculture. The change is necessary to
            remove the limit to maximum lending to non-bank financial
            institutions (NBFIs), and will increase the borrowing limit
            from 50 percent to 70 percent of their equity. This change
            will complement the recent reallocation done on March 23,
            2011 to allow disbursement of remaining International
            Development Association (IDA) funds to NBFIs.
